india.name: Howrah Bridge
india.activities_details: The iconic Howrah Bridge is an architectural wonder in itself. Commissioned in 1943, it is the busiest cantilever bridge in the world and is also among the most-visited structures in Kolkata. Make sure that you visit the bridge during the night when it is illuminated, giving it a magical charm.

india.name: New Market
india.activities_details: One of the most exciting things to do in Kolkata is shopping.It definitely helps that the city has a number of markets where you can find everything from garments to jewelry and even home decor items.

india.name: Kolkata street food
india.description: There’s no doubt that Kolkata is a foodie’s paradise. You will find the city enticing you with soulful treats in almost every nook and corner. Here are some places we recommend you to try: Theatre Road, Shyam Bazaar, Deshapriya Park, Gariahat More, Park Street, Vivekananda Park, and Dacre Lane.
india.activities_details: Get acquainted with the Indian culture through the food. Some must try foods include Phuchkas, Rolls, Aloo Chop, Ghugni, Jhalmuri, Shingara, Peyaji, and Chanar Jilipi.

india.name: Botanical Gardens
india.description: This sprawling garden spreading across 109 hectares is home to around 12000 species of plants and trees, some of which are quite rare. The main attraction of this garden is the Great Banyan, a huge banyan tree which is touted to be the largest tree in the country and perhaps in the whole of Asia.
india.activities_details: Location: Shibpur, Howrah; Entry fee: 10 rupees

india.name: The Heritage Walk of Calcutta
india.description: Calcutta is a city that reflects the best of heritage, culture and history of the era gone by. Unlike many other cities , Calcutta was totally built and founded by the British and it still remains a mirror image of the colonial era architecture and style, it has that charm that holds to the old and new together.
india.activities_details: Departure point: The Oberoi Grand, Kolkata, 15, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, New Market Area, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata, West Bengal 700013, India. Inclusions: guide fees, transport cost during the tour, small local snacks.

india.name: Learn to cook authentic North Indian Food & dine with the chef
india.description: With the help of your native host, you not only learn the authentic ways of cooking Indian Food but also get the in depth knowledge of why each spice is being used and what are the health benefits of each food item. Your host is an Ayurvedic Doctor and also a certified Bikram Yoga Teacher. She also owns a Travel Company which organizes International And Inbound Tours.
india.activities_details: Departure point: 21, Shyamananda Rd, Bakul Bagan, Bhowanipore, Kolkata, West Bengal 700025, India. Iclusion: Dinner. Exclusion: Alcoholic beverages.

india.name: Hooghly's Flower Fest Tour
india.description: A chance to experience the lives of the people who live by the river and one of the best places to photograph the bridge. Once one has soaked in a bit of the enigma of this life by the river one is ready to face the hustle and bustle of a very busy but vibrant wholesale and retail flower market.
india.activities_details: Departure point: Mullick ghat flower market foot bridge, 68/3, Strand Bank Rd, Fairley Place, B.B.D. Bagh, Kolkata, West Bengal 700001, India. Inclusions: All Fees and Taxes, bottled water, local chai, street side local food

india.name: Pilgrimage tour of Ganga Sagar
india.description: Ganga Sagar is a wonderful island situated just off the Bengal coast and on the point where River Ganga meets the Bay of Bengal. The stunning island is a place of peace, calm, golden sand beaches and of religion. Every year in the month of January the island sees a huge gathering of devotees from all parts of the country, who come to take a dip in the holy waters.
india.activities_details: Private Full Day Tour of Ganga Sagar with Air Conditioner Vehicle. Enjoy Ganga Sagar Pilgrimage and Fair, Sagardwip Overview, Explore Kapil Muni Temple, Sagar Marine Park and Sagar Light House, other landmarks of the island. Enjoy Boating Ride while Reach to Ganga Sagar from Harwood Point. Ferry Tickets Included

india.name: Hello Calcutta - Walk and experience the 'city of joy'
india.description: Hello Calcutta! introduces you to local lives, culture and heritage of Kolkata (Calcutta) 'the city of joy' during a 4 hours Cultural Walk tour
india.activities_details: Walk with us to visit the oldest market. Experience the early morning chaos of locals Market. Visit India’s largest Flower Market and walk on the world’s busiest iconic bridge 'Howrah Bridge'. Explore Kumartuli(potter’ s town / colony), interact with local artiste and see them handcrafting clay idols. Breakfast at a local restaurant.

india.name: Park Street
india.description: A hub for shopaholics during the day and a dazzling place by night, Park Street is perfect for your weekend brunches with friends. Spend a day splurging on both expensive designer brands and products from local sellers.

india.name: Victoria Memorial
india.description: Have you really visited Kolkata if you didn’t stop by the Victoria Memorial and get its photo for your Insta feed? No, you haven’t! This quintessential tourist attraction of Kolkata is perfect for both history and architecture buffs. Complete with 21 verdant gardens, exquisite artefacts and paintings.
india.activities_details: Opening hours: 10:00 to 17:00 (closed on Mondays) for museum. 5:30 to 18:00 (all days) for the gardens

india.name: Blue Mug Cafe
india.description: Brunch dates with friends is a good idea if you are looking to catch up with your tribe. And there is one cafe in Jodhpur Park which is just apt for it. The greenery outside the Blue Mug Cafe lends a cool atmosphere and the guitar and piano inside the cafe makes for Insta-worthy pictures.
india.activities_details: Location: Jodhpur Park, Opening hours: 11:00 to 22:30

india.name: Mother House
india.description: A regular flow of mostly Christian pilgrims visits the Missionaries of Charity’s 'Motherhouse' to pay homage at Mother (and now Saint) Teresa’s large, sober tomb. A small adjacent museum room displays Teresa’s worn sandals and battered enamel dinner bowl. Located upstairs is the room where she worked and slept from 1953 to 1997, preserved in all its simplicity.
india.activities_details: From Sudder St, walk for about 15 minutes along Alimuddin St, then two minutes south. It's in the second alley to the right.

india.name: Terreti Bazar
india.description: Chinese street food breakfast. Here you’ll find an interesting mixture of Chinese Indians, Indians, shoppers, eaters, and depending on what day you go, a crowd that has just finished partying the night away and is looking for something tasty to eat.

india.name: Eco-Tourism Park
india.description: Eco-Tourism Park in Kolkata is an expansive urban park designed to promote eco-tourism in the city. The beauty of the location increases ten folds because of a water body that surrounds the park and forms an island in the middle. It is often visited by picnickers or those who want a quick escape from mundane lives.
india.activities_details: Eco Tourism Park is located at a distance of 18 kilometres from the city centre. Taxis or private vehicles are the best modes of transport in Kolkata to reach the park via VIP road or Thakurnagar Panchpota Road and NH12.

cuba.name: Old Square
cuba.description: What is now called the Old Square was originally Plaza Nueva (New Square), built as a popular alternative to Plaza de Armas, the military and government nerve center. Later called Plaza del Mercado (Market Square) as Havana's commercial hub, Plaza Vieja was the site of executions, processions, bullfights, and fiestas.
cuba.activities_details: Husband has to say Ping and then wife would reply pong

cuba.name: Old Havana
cuba.description: Bohemian, rhythmically Latin, certainly picturesque and, above all, charming.
cuba.activities_details: One of the best things to do in Havana is to take a tour of Old Havana. It is the historical center of the Cuban capital and much of the area was constructed during the Spanish colonial era, which is apparent in the city’s baroque and neoclassical architecture. Old Havana can be reached from any part of downtown Havana, on foot.

cuba.name: Vintage car
cuba.description: Tour Havana in style with a classic American car. These cars are remarkably well-preserved and while pricey, offer an excellent way to tour the city.
cuba.activities_details: The standard price is 50 CUC (50 USD) for a three-hour tour of the city’s main attractions. If you choose not to book in advance, cars can easily be rented from Central Park, near the Capitolio.

cuba.name: Malecón
cuba.description: Take a stroll down the Malecon
cuba.activities_details: The Malecón, Havana’s 5 mile (8 kilometer) long seafront highway, is the one place in the city that fully captures the spirit of the Cuban people. The ocean crashing against the shore, combined with the roar of cars down the highway and the laughter of locals enjoying the view, create a uniquely Cuban experience.

cuba.name: Havana Cathedral
cuba.description: Cuban novelist Alejo Carpentier once described Havana’s incredible cathedral as ‘music set in stone’. It was consecrated as Havana Cathedral in 1789, and some of Christopher Columbus’ remains were kept here between 1796 and 1898.
cuba.activities_details: The Cathedral is free to enter and the interior is just as impressive as the exterior.  The cathedral is located in the heart of Old Havana and therefore it is easily reachable on foot

cuba.name: Callejón de Hamel
cuba.description: The Callejón de Hamel is a two-block-long alley, between Aramburu and Hospital Streets in Centro Habana, that has become a shrine to Afro-Cuban religions. The buildings are lined with brightly-colored paintings, murals, sculptures and objects, which depict rituals and deities.
cuba.activities_details: If you want to enjoy Cuban Rumba music in its most authentic form, stop by the Callejon on Sundays, starting at noon, for the festivities.

cuba.name: Salsa dancing
cuba.description: When in Havana, going salsa dancing is a must-do activity. Various clubs across the city offer a great atmosphere and live music to enjoy salsa dancing.
cuba.activities_details: One of the most popular salsa places is Club 1830. It is mostly frequented by locals, who will be more than happy to teach you a few moves. The Latin music played by live bands here is upbeat, perfect for salsa dancing.

cuba.name: San Cristóbal Paladar
cuba.description: Try homemade food, enjoy rum and other drinks and smoke a cigar at a paladar in Havana!
cuba.activities_details: Paladar or paladares are essentially family-run restaurants in Havana that are a great way to try out authentic Cuban food.
